data.text:
Enhancing access to basic public services requires additional resources. Governments can raise more revenue w/ more progressive taxation & better ways to collect taxes already in place. Our #IMFblog discusses the various tax reform options. 
#FiscalMonitor https://t.co/R9D28UmVTM

Breaking the cycle of #inequality requires policies that create extra disposable income for the most vulnerable groups and access to basic public services and good jobs. 
 
Our new #IMFblog has the details: https://t.co/ngWjilYmHq #FiscalMonitor https://t.co/0jTfk7gj6G

JUST RELEASED:  The new #FiscalMonitor “A Fair Shot”' shows how the pandemic intensified inequalities and outlines how to blunt the negative impact of inequality on the most vulnerable groups in society.
https://t.co/4yV6zroLRJ https://t.co/lKdbzerCCR
TUNE IN NOW: IMF’s @PaoloMauroEcon talks to @Henry_Curr about what policymakers can do to give everybody a fair shot. https://t.co/4yV6zroLRJ #FiscalMonitor https://t.co/jweYNhcUGt

IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva during her speech ahead of the 2021 #IMFmeetings:

"Without the extraordinary & synchronized measures—including $16 trillion in fiscal action—the global contraction last year would have been at least three times worse."

📽️https://t.co/ZPkFWKNta6 https://t.co/CBsrCIwuOb

REPLAY: IMF’s John Bluedorn discusses with Washington Post’s @byHeatherLong the impact of the COVID-19 recession on workers and the policy priorities for governments. Read and download the research here: https://t.co/hcZ4l9djxV #WEO https://t.co/Pn30fmd0tb

What will be the long-term effects of the pandemic, and what are the priorities for policymakers? Watch the replay of our discussion and download our new World Economic Outlook research here: https://t.co/hcZ4l9uUWv #WEO https://t.co/2b3f5370nJ

The pandemic's damage to economies will vary within and across countries, depending on the structure of economies and the policy response. More in our latest #WEO research. https://t.co/71UGT83MCS https://t.co/oxyefDFcdP

Faster progress in ending the health crisis could add almost $9 trillion to global GDP by 2025. But the window of opportunity is closing fast. The longer it takes to speed vaccination, the harder it will be to achieve these gains. 

More ➡️https://t.co/n9sbMaGSIg #IMFmeetings https://t.co/lKDXgnY9TH

REPLAY: IMF’s John Bluedorn discusses with Washington Post’s 
@byHeatherLong the impact of the COVID-19 recession on workers and the policy priorities for governments. Watch and download the research here: https://t.co/hcZ4l9uUWv #WEO

We project world output to be about 3% lower in 2024 than pre-pandemic projections. Losses will be largest among low-income countries. Read more in #IMFblog. https://t.co/KWY6HUlod5 #WEO https://t.co/kqDqM7rjud

The pandemic has exposed and intensified existing inequalities.
 
On April 1, @PaoloMauroEcon discusses w/ @Henry_Curr actions policymakers can take to reverse this alarming trend.
 
https://t.co/4yV6zroLRJ https://t.co/8o2ZuqDoje
Our latest World Economic Outlook research projects that the pandemic will lead to a 3% loss in global output in 2024. Read more: https://t.co/hcZ4l9uUWv #WEO https://t.co/qYro9Evm7C

Streaming NOW: A discussion on possible damage to the economy by the pandemic. Watch the discussion, and read our new World Economic Outlook research here: https://t.co/hcZ4l9uUWv #WEO https://t.co/kC3AVfmYM5

The IMF Executive Board has approved the second financial assistance to South Sudan since it joined the IMF in 2012 – US$174.2 million to help address the continuing impact of the pandemic. https://t.co/XjY8ReFnFF #IMFAfrica https://t.co/deMiXOGsnR

Young people and lower-skilled workers have experienced more significant rises in unemployment rates due to the pandemic. Our latest research looks at priorities to improve job prospects. https://t.co/hcZ4l9uUWv #WEO https://t.co/5Fn3xVUcOf

LIVE: IMF’s John Bluedorn discusses with Washington Post’s @byHeatherLong the impact of the COVID-19 recession on workers and the policy priorities for governments. Watch and download the research here: https://t.co/hcZ4l9uUWv #WEO https://t.co/6r4jxHIyYa

In our latest #WEO research, we find the right balance of job support during the crisis, and a transition to policies that ease movement of workers to growing sectors can create a more sustainable recovery. Read more on #IMFBlog: https://t.co/JM57QWmycn https://t.co/ctgIzlqKP1

The IMF has stepped up to help fight the crisis, including new financing to 85 countries. Now support is building for a possible SDR allocation of $650 billion—this would benefit all our members, but especially the most vulnerable. 
👉https://t.co/7g74pJ98Yk #IMFmeetings https://t.co/rcKHnogBo8

IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva discusses the outlook for the global economy and the policies to shape a post-crisis world where everyone gets a fair shot during her speech at the @cfr_org. 

▶️ Watch the replay: https://t.co/di44w9dsVu #IMFmeetings https://t.co/vbWEm65gTg

IMF Managing Director @KGeorgiave discusses the outlook for the global economy and the policies to shape a post-crisis world where everyone gets a fair shot during her speech at the @cfr_org. 

▶️ Watch the replay: https://t.co/di44w9dsVu  #IMFmeetings https://t.co/yeh5EDJClx

“Millions of people are benefiting from vaccines, but there is danger. Too many continue to face job losses & rising poverty. What we do now will shape the post-crisis world." 
@KGeorgieva on the global outlook & policy priorities ahead of the #IMFmeetings https://t.co/qQYHTJPw9V https://t.co/YA76NqnOFM

JOIN US APR 1, 9 AM (ET) 
The IMF’s @PaoloMauroEcon discusses w/ @Henry_Curr
of @TheEconomist how governments can tackle rising #inequality resulting from the pandemic. #FiscalMonitor
https://t.co/4yV6zroLRJ https://t.co/EqMUHCtiaF

Tune in tomorrow, March 31, at 1:00 PM ET as CNBC’s @Silvia_Amaro discusses the after-effects of the pandemic with IMF economists Sonali Das and Philippe Wingender. https://t.co/qk3zOCRCOn #WEO https://t.co/kC3AVfmYM5

Did you know that government #debt levels are at historic highs? Join our who’s who lineup @KGeorgieva @SongweVera @elerianm & moderator @martinwolf_  @fteconomics as they talk about the risks and the fixes on April 6.  
https://t.co/y0hPphBQxe

#TackleDebtTraps https://t.co/WaORo8hCGh
Tackling debt vulnerabilities now is critical to prevent divergent recoveries. What can countries achieve by managing debt properly? #TackleDebtTraps

Can more transparency and better debt architecture reduce the risks of the highest levels of government #debt in years? @KGeorgieva @SongweVera @elerianm & moderator @martinwolf_  @fteconomics discuss these fixes and more on April 6. https://t.co/y0hPphBQxe

#TackleDebtTraps https://t.co/6YSZRxWfUz
How worried are you about mounting public debt as governments spend to fight the pandemic? #TackleDebtTraps

Join us on March 31 at 8 AM for a discussion on economic and social transformation with the IMF’s Jihad Azour and Alejandro Werner, @LSEnews’ Minouche Shafik, @AIIB_Official’s @ErikBerglof, @CarnegieEndow’s @MarwanMuasher, and @ColumbiaSIPA’s @MauricioCard https://t.co/0xrVjfr4Q6

As the world gradually recovers from the pandemic, low-income countries are at risk of falling behind. But the right actions and policies can prevent this. Read the latest analysis: https://t.co/kbXoCq19RJ https://t.co/J75XfAUBwB

IMF Chief @KGeorgieva highlights 3️⃣ policy priorities to give people a fair shot—a shot in the arm to end the pandemic everywhere, and a shot at a better future for vulnerable people and countries to pave the way to inclusive and sustainable recovery. 
➡️ https://t.co/g1VJMy57MG https://t.co/M4MOvZpY2B

📽️LIVE NOW: “Giving People a Fair Shot—Policies to Secure the Recovery”

Speech by IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva ahead of the 2021 Spring #IMFMeetings, followed by a conversation with @FareedZakaria at the @cfr_org. https://t.co/yyBDybRbGz https://t.co/f1dnFBxUwj

IMF Chief @KGeorgieva will discuss the global economy & policy priorities ahead of the 2021 IMF/World Bank Spring Meetings in a conversation with @CFR_org, moderated by @FareedZakaria. 

Join the conversation TODAY, March 30 at 11 AM ET:  https://t.co/cTkha3LqRs #IMFmeetings https://t.co/tE87laa549

ICYMI: We just released our latest #GFSR chapter on commercial real estate. Replay a conversation between IMF’s Natalucci and Deghi and @CNBCi’s @Silvia_Amaro. https://t.co/CYiVksMuu3 https://t.co/7ZhvTV1bpY

An increase in leverage (borrowing to invest), while needed in the short term to cushion the economic impact of the pandemic, might pose a risk to financial stability further down the road. Read more in the latest #IMFBlog: https://t.co/rh8uuHGiOv #GFSR

Tune in for a conversation with @AureliaFNguyen, Managing Director of the #COVAX Facility and IMF’s @bhatiasi on the challenges of vaccine procurement and distribution. #IMFInspired 

📅 Watch: April 5, 1:00 pm ET https://t.co/C0SmkyxB5I https://t.co/NBt1mY4YsE

IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva Appoints Bernard Lauwers as Director of the Finance Department. 

Read the press release: https://t.co/TnjN84YWLk https://t.co/NMgJGETkBi

In both advanced and emerging market economies, borrowing has increased even further as a result of the policy support provided in response to the COVID-19 shock. What will this mean for global financial stability? The latest #GFSR explains: https://t.co/JAGqEf9ykT #IMFBlog https://t.co/bqIeEeflDR

A year after the #COVID19 pandemic was declared, what’s ahead for the world economy? 

Don’t miss IMF Chief @KGeorgieva’s discussion on the global outlook and policies to build fairer & more sustainable economies with @FareedZakaria at the @CFR_org. https://t.co/y4XpWcnzJb https://t.co/WEs0rCmYWi

A Policymaker’s Dilemma: Easing financial conditions provide a boost to economic activity in the short term. But further along, they mean a heightened risk of a sharp downturn. How to find the right tradeoff: https://t.co/qRAEtXtjhI #GFSR #IMFBlog

Leverage, or borrowing to invest, can provide a bridge to the economic recovery during a crisis. But high levels or rapid increases in leverage can signal vulnerabilities in the financial system. Read the latest #GFSR chapter: https://t.co/7q4Zy19ID9 https://t.co/ol2UDJ9JFj

Low rates have helped with the early recovery in the commercial real estate sector. But easy financial conditions could encourage too much risk-taking and policymakers may need to turn to other policy tools. Read the latest #IMFBlog: https://t.co/POQuvOvOwp #GFSR

The commercial real estate sector matters for broader financial and economic stability: the sector is large; its price movements tend to reflect the broader economy; and, it relies heavily on debt funding. Read more in the latest #IMFBlog: https://t.co/Masit8f7V2 #GFSR https://t.co/GrMimNAVtq

As more office workers continue to work from home, what happens to the office space they used to occupy? New #GFSR research looks at the potential disruptions to the commercial real estate market and the possible threats to financial stability. https://t.co/89lF2vqSgs #IMFBlog https://t.co/CbfZnCBbxT

Lockdown measures have hurt retailers, with many permanently closing. New #GFSR research looks at how this trend could affect the commercial real estate market, including possible threats to financial stability. https://t.co/wmokTYSESJ https://t.co/C7V3FIVijD

LIVE: IMF’s Fabio Natalucci and Andrea Deghi and @CNBCi’s @Silvia_Amaro discuss the impact of COVID-19 on the commercial real estate market and its possible threats to financial stability. Read the report: https://t.co/nFwy0TNsbx #GFSR https://t.co/QdvJgpR1K7

.@KGeorgieva joins the High-Level Meeting on International Debt Architecture and Liquidity - Financing for Development in the Era of COVID-19 and Beyond Initiative, TODAY March 29 at 10:00 am ET. #Fin4Dev #GlobalGoals

Watch LIVE on @UNWebTV 
https://t.co/fro8FbqZLY

Managing Director @KGeorgieva joined @DMiliband and Ruth Porat on the @Google Zeitgeist podcast to discuss inequality, technology, and how we can prevent a climate crisis. Listen here: https://t.co/VnvHP4b7lI https://t.co/eiSLPKL3PY

Save the date and join us on March 31 at 10:00 AM ET to discuss the impact of the pandemic on workers with the IMF's John Bluedorn and Washington Post's @byHeatherLong. #WEO https://t.co/qk3zOCRCOn https://t.co/EhF9sCQXtx

Join us on March 31 at 8:00 AM ET for a discussion on how the pandemic can serve as an opportunity for countries in #Europe, #LatinAmerica, and #MENA region to overhaul their economies, making them smarter, fairer, greener & more conducive to job creation. https://t.co/0xrVjfr4Q6

What is the impact of COVID-19 on the commercial real estate market? Join us tomorrow at 9am EDT with IMF’s Fabio Natalucci and Andrea Deghi and @CNBCi’s @Silvia_Amaro. https://t.co/n4EUZCSGeU #GFSR https://t.co/QdvJgpzqlx

IMF Chief @KGeorgieva will discuss the global economy & policy priorities ahead of the 2021 IMF/World Bank Spring Meetings in a conversation with @CFR_org, moderated by @FareedZakaria. 

Join the conversation on Tuesday, March 30 at 11 AM ET: https://t.co/cTkha3LqRs #IMFmeetings https://t.co/EkCHaPWaqu

Managing Director @KGeorgieva joined @DMiliband and Ruth Porat on the @Google Zeitgeist podcast to discuss inequality, technology, and how we can prevent a climate crisis. Listen here: https://t.co/VnvHP4b7lI https://t.co/sj3f4Y0Hsz

Our digital footprint generates enormous value, but too much of it ends up in Big Tech silos, according to a new #FandD article by the IMF’s Yan Carrière-Swallow and Vikram Haksar. 

Find it in F&D’s Spring 2021 issue here: https://t.co/alsYq4lU1p https://t.co/3ZfCSsOoLv

Even in the best scenarios, historic carbon emissions mean some global warming and #climatechange will be inevitable. Rising seas alone could potentially submerge cities and wipe out island nations. Asian countries need urgent measures to adapt. Read more: https://t.co/sDBph6f1n2 https://t.co/uC9djeSqUc

Sign up for our special 7-day newsletter to stay up-to-date on the digital schedule, report launches and other highlights from the 2021 Spring Meetings. https://t.co/ikwrlOgCxl #IMFmeetings https://t.co/CSMVIrJm4M

The latest IMF #WeekendRead newsletter has updates on Special Drawing Rights, trade's role in the recovery, the IMF's climate approach, China's recovery, financial inclusion, and much more. Read and subscribe for weekly updates: https://t.co/dvgUUtsi1A https://t.co/iPivLgYsOS

How does the impact of the COVID-19 recession on workers compare with past downturns? What policies are needed to support workers? Join us on March 31 for the launch of our new research. https://t.co/qk3zOCRCOn #WEO https://t.co/6r4jxHIyYa

REPLAY: One-on-one conversation with @KGeorgieva and Microsoft President @BradSmi, moderated by MSNBC’s @AliVelshi, exploring how economists and technologists can collaborate to lay the groundwork for a better future. #IMFexchange https://t.co/XuXVTvW9EM

Tune in Monday at 9am EDT for a conversation on the latest #GFSR research on commercial real estate featuring IMF’s Fabio Natalucci and Andrea Deghi and @CNBCi’s @Silvia_Amaro. https://t.co/Vu9whrO8om https://t.co/QdvJgpR1K7

What will be the long-term effects of the pandemic and what are the priorities for policymakers?

New staff analysis sheds light on the best policies on carbon taxes, how countries can adapt, and how to create a #greenrecovery in #Asia. https://t.co/sfb4lFLE6w https://t.co/8cXPgbGfpn

#Sudan’s continued commitment to economic reforms could pave the way to debt relief and new financial support from development partners and a better future for its people. Click here to read the key messages and takeaways: https://t.co/FJGz4ftdZh

IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva Appoints Brenda Boultwood as Director of the Office of Risk Management. 

Read the full statement: https://t.co/ANH7R7QrKC https://t.co/8TIUOsfN2T
To learn more about the latest IMF and @WorldBank announcement on #Sudan, click here to read the FAQs: https://t.co/bACCQmBp0H https://t.co/Lmr9gGz1F0

#Breaking News: #Sudan’s sustained commitment to economic reforms supports eligibility for debt relief under the Highly Indebted Poor Country initiative by the IMF and @WorldBank. Click here to read the press release: https://t.co/52ks2cZuDj

Pursuing a #greenrecovery in the aftermath of #COVID19 might sound daunting, but it’s actually a great opportunity to use spending on the recovery to create sustainable jobs and growth. #Asia can lead the way. Read some new IMF staff analysis.

https://t.co/22MJlpqzPj

The IMF/@WorldBank CSO forum is on👍

Join us for 19 sessions on issues such as climate, inequality, debt, COVID-19 vaccine and anti-corruption.

Save the date and join us on March 31 at 10:00 AM ET to discuss the impact of the pandemic on workers with the IMF's John Bluedorn and Washington Post's @byHeatherLong. #WEO https://t.co/qk3zOCRCOn https://t.co/wYmJ1f7zJV

📅 SAVE THE DATE: IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva will present the global economic outlook and discuss policy priorities ahead of the IMF/World Bank 2021 Spring Meetings with the @CFR_org. 

Tues, 3/30 at 11AM ET: https://t.co/m4PLEqWMy9 #IMFMeetings https://t.co/ntpQf0qADE

#Korea has weathered the economic crisis caused by the pandemic comparatively well. The focus is now to speed up the recovery and boost post-pandemic growth. Read more in our annual review: https://t.co/aRq9IMopPw https://t.co/c84dGAl5wF

Digitalization can transform economies and lives. But it needs to be inclusive with a focus on regulation, investment in digital skills and infrastructure. Our latest issue of F&D explores the digital future. https://t.co/mZENc2yjHL #IMFBlog https://t.co/6dLJ2bSaFS

The IMF has three main roles: providing economic advice, lending to countries in need, and working with governments to modernize their economic policies and train their people. Learn more about our work in the latest Annual Report.  https://t.co/Y06zNotphC https://t.co/EcAlda1q7Y

Our research shows that improving public spending on #education, #health, and #social protection:

✔️ Reduces #poverty and #inequality
✔️ Leads to higher #literacy rates
✔️ Lowers mortality rates

Click here to read the full report:  https://t.co/G2t7VbhgNA https://t.co/hU98O5vVJ2

Financing must be sustainable and resilient, AND sustainability and resilience must be financed. Read the latest #Fin4Dev report by a partnership of international institutions, including the IMF: https://t.co/BbXG9Xojma #SDGs #GlobalGoals https://t.co/1Q0bD4Hgav

#Pakistan’s economic reform program has been critical in addressing the COVID-19 crisis and supporting the economy, thus saving lives and livelihoods. https://t.co/WFaSy51UYv

After reviewing #Pakistan’s reform program supported by the IMF Extended Fund Facility, the Fund’s Executive Board approved the immediate disbursement of about US$500 million for budget support. https://t.co/WFaSy51UYv

Technology can help usher in a period of shared growth after the pandemic – if we shape it in a way that creates jobs and spurs inclusive growth. Read our latest issue of #FandD Magazine. https://t.co/bZ9qfAig4a https://t.co/jlFi4XOTih

Acceleration of digitalization has benefited many, but the risk is a Great Divergence where some countries benefit from automation & digitalization and others fall behind. 

@KGeorgieva & @BradSmi talk about digital transformations: https://t.co/yseJtzp0fy #IMFExchange https://t.co/cbjPmS8HEw

A 1 degree Celsius (1.8 degree Fahrenheit) increase in temperature will raise Sub-Saharan Africa’s electricity consumption by about 7%. Find out more at #IMFBlog https://t.co/96ck3JXQGH #ChartOfTheWeek https://t.co/hnOVo36MFW

#Climatechange is a huge risk to economic and financial stability. At the IMF, we are putting climate-resilient economies at the heart of our work.  Want to learn more? Join the #InvestingInClimateAction event on March 24 feat. @KGeorgieva https://t.co/n3KdOWOHPc https://t.co/HQwjIywOC3

#SierraLeone's education minister, David Sengeh, wants every child to have access to quality education. In #FandD, @DSengeh describes why his country has linked education to its development agenda in an attempt to narrow inequality. https://t.co/5yKvK7ZzEb https://t.co/ExYfQZHgNa

In October 2020, The Bahamas leapfrogged into the digital vanguard with the launch of the world’s first central bank digital currency—the sand dollar. More in #FandD: https://t.co/lW8qGLDJm2 https://t.co/xkqW4iJlbv
